summary: FBI interview transcript from February 2021 where a witness describes recognizing Jeffrey Epstein from her high school days as a substitute teacher, and details her later encounters with individuals including Jimmy Savile, Dr. Ernst Gubler, and the Dubins at international trade shows where she heard discussions about 'sex slaves.' The witness connects flight logs to trade show attendance and suggests Leon Black's involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Witness believes he was her substitute teacher in high school, recognized from news coverage; later appears in her photos from trade shows.

persons.name: Jimmy Savile
persons.context: Described as a sexual deviant; attended trade shows in New Orleans; had parties with people who discussed children flying to the US.

persons.name: Dr. Ernst Gubler
persons.context: Owner of a company; described as a sexual deviant who claimed to drink children's blood; involved with Glen and Eva Dubin; had a wife named Helga.

persons.name: Helga
persons.context: Ex-hooker, wife of Dr. Ernst Gubler; made the witness uncomfortable.

persons.name: Glen Dubin
persons.context: Involved with Dr. Ernst Gubler; knew Leon Black; his wife Eva Dubin was a doctor treating the witness's boss's wife.

persons.name: Eva Dubin
persons.context: Wife of Glen Dubin; doctor who treated the witness's boss's wife; involved with Dr. Ernst Gubler.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Described as an 'asshole' in the office by receptionist Cindy Cooper; witness believes he was involved based on flight logs matching trade shows.

persons.name: Cindy Cooper
persons.context: Receptionist who identified Leon Black as the 'asshole' in the office when asked by the witness.

persons.name: L. Delgado
persons.context: Appeared in the witness's photos; worked at an unspecified company.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: FBI analyst who drafted the FD-302 report.

persons.name: Kimberly R. Meder
persons.context: FBI agent associated with the document drafting.

connections.description: Witness believes Epstein was her flirtatious substitute teacher when she was 17, and he appeared in a pornographic magazine.
Both attended trade shows and were described as sexual deviants; associated with the same social circles.
Gubler was involved with Glen and Eva Dubin; social and possibly financial connections implied.
Witness states Glen and Leon Black knew each other.
Gubler and Helga are married; Helga is described as an ex-hooker.

events.title: Witness starts billion dollar business
events.description: Witness began a 'billion dollar business' and started attending international trade shows.

events.title: Encounter with alleged sex slave
events.description: While working in California, witness met a young woman (16/17) with the Dubins who said she was a sex slave and her passport was taken.

events.title: FBI virtual interview of witness
events.description: Witness interviewed by FBI over video conference, providing information about Epstein, Savile, Gubler, Dubins, and trade show activities.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Witness believes Jeffrey Epstein was her substitute teacher at George Washington High School when she was 17, and he appeared in a pornographic magazine from that era.
At international trade shows, witness heard conversations about children being flown to the United States and people bringing 'sex slaves' to parties, with attendees laughing about it.
Dr. Ernst Gubler claimed to drink the blood of children to invigorate his sexual life and reportedly raised a child left on his doorstep who later became a 'lunatic.'
In 1999, witness encountered a young woman with Glen and Eva Dubin who said she was a sex slave and her passport had been taken.
Witness connected flight logs to trade show attendance and suggested Leon Black was involved in these activities.
